text:
Ok so I listen several times a day almost every day for a year, and then a little less often for like 2 months, the don't for, maybe 3 weeks?
Anyway, I come back and it starts right around 3:42 like I was finishing a movie or something. Only other times that's ever happened were with Dopesmoker, but that's 63:36 long. Idk lol just sharing this strange occurrence to anyone interested. Has this happened to you before?

author: ParrotMan01

text:
My favorite Glover song was the Pirate Zone Stage 3.. the one with the accordion and the monkeys doing a solo. I remember back in the old days where I took that song and recorded it on a cassette tape just so I could have an easy way to hear it all over again. (along with Waverace 64's Drake Lake)

Now that we have the Internet, we won't have to do anything like that again... I have mixed feelings at a fact like that.
author: Madman Asa

text:
Oh man, this game was great! I had the PS version, so controls weren't that bad...
For this game, you pretty much had to guide the ball to the goal. You could separate from the ball and explore on your own, and you could transform the ball into different forms, like a tiny marble, a bowling ball, a bouncy ball... All forms changed the physics, friction, and attacks. It was really kinda cool... But the game was so difficult. Good times.

author: JDilla2812

text:
@Masz52 I'm not saying the controls in Glover are complete garbage. The last time I played the game was at least a decade ago. I have no idea how it controls.
I'm just speaking in general, and when I said "complete garbage", that was referring to my rather extreme example of bad controls that you could "get used to."
author: Cheeseman

author: Dabomb0789

text: @321cheeseman The controls in Glover could be annoying but not annoying enough that I'd consider them "complete garbage."
author: Masz52

text:
@Masz52 I've have never understood or agreed with the concept of needing to "get used to" controls. If the controls are overly complicated, annoying, confusing, unresponsive, or unintuitive, then they are bad.
Like, imagine Super Mario Bros. with a one second delay between button presses and actions on screen. Yeah, you could get used to that and play the game pretty well, but the controls would still be complete garbage.
